title: Genesis - In Concert 1976 (HQ Laserdisc 60 FPS transfer)
description:
Genesis - In Concert 1976 (HQ Laserdisc 60 FPS transfer)

IMPORTANT: I recommend NOT using VLC to play it. There is a well-known
issue regarding VLC and 60 FPS videos. It is very jerky on Windows
when using hardware acceleration due to a bug in VLC's timing code.
I highly recommend using "Media Player Classic: Home Cinema" instead.
If you must use VLC, be sure to disable hardware acceleration! This
bug does not effect Linux or Mac versions of VLC.

NOTE: You can download only the sample AVI file first
by unchecking the other files in your bittorrent client.
It is small, and you can sample the video/audio quality
of the entire download before getting the rest of it.

 Title: In Concert 1976
Artist: Genesis
 Media: Laserdisc

Length: 42 minutes, 41 seconds.

Notes: This is a high-quality 60 FPS transfer from the rare
       laserdisc release. Uncompressed video capture card
       (older bt878 based Hauppauge WinTV) was used which
       provides a much better picture quality compared to
       the now common capture boards with onboard MPEG-2
       encoding.

       The original film's audio is somewhat flat. Not too
       bad, but I made some careful, minor EQ tweaks to fix
       it. I think it sounds excellent now.

       You will not find a higher quality version of this
       anywhere, ever. I promise you that! It blows away the
       version on the bonus DVD that came with the Trick of
       The Tail re-release CD in 2007.


Video: MPEG4 Video (H264) 720x330 59.94fps 2797kbps [Video 0]
Audio: Dolby AC3 48000Hz stereo 448kbps [Audio 1]

Concert set list:
1. I Know What I Like
2. Fly on a Windshield
3. Carpet Crawlers
4. The Cinema Show (part 2)
5. Entangled
6. Supper's Ready (part 2)
7. Los Endos

Encoding: Video is compressed using x264vfw codec. Motion
          search set to highest possible quality, using a
          two-pass bitrate control method. Audio has been
          compressed into AC3 448 kbps 2-channel stereo
          from PCM capture source.
